publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1878 Helen Eadie: OCLI International—That the Parliament notes with deep concern the loss of 160 jobs caused by the closure of OCLI International at Dalgety Bay in Dunfermline East constituency; urges OCLI to work together with those being made redundant to minimise the difficulties faced by them and their families, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to involve itself fully in the search for a positive resolution to their current plight.

S1M-1878 Helen Eadie: OCLI International—That the Parliament notes with deep concern the loss of 160 jobs caused by the closure of OCLI International at Dalgety Bay in Dunfermline East constituency; urges OCLI to work together with those being made redundant to minimise the difficulties faced by them and their families, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to involve itself fully in the search for a positive resolution to their current plight.
S1M-1878 OCLI International (lodged on 26 April 2001) Pauline McNeill*, Bristow Muldoon*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1878 OCLI International (lodged on 26 April 2001) Irene Oldfather*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-1878 OCLI International (lodged on 26 April 2001) Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-1878 OCLI International (lodged on 26 April 2001) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*

S1M-1878 Helen Eadie: OCLI International—That the Parliament notes with deep concern the loss of 160 jobs caused by the closure of OCLI International at Dalgety Bay in Dunfermline East constituency; urges OCLI to work together with those being made redundant to minimise the difficulties faced by them and their families, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to involve itself fully in the search for a positive resolution to their current plight. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Bristow Muldoon, Donald Gorrie, Irene Oldfather, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Cathy Jamieson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh
S1M-1878 OCLI International (lodged on 26 April 2001) Marilyn Livingstone*, Scott Barrie*

S1M-1878 Helen Eadie: OCLI International—That the Parliament notes with deep concern the loss of 160 jobs caused by the closure of OCLI International at Dalgety Bay in Dunfermline East constituency; urges OCLI to work together with those being made redundant to minimise the difficulties faced by them and their families, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to involve itself fully in the search for a positive resolution to their current plight. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Bristow Muldoon, Donald Gorrie, Irene Oldfather, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Cathy Jamieson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Marilyn Livingstone, Scott Barrie, Alex Neil*
S1M-1878 OCLI International (lodged on 26 April 2001) Mr Michael McMahon*, Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1878 Helen Eadie: OCLI International—That the Parliament notes with deep concern the loss of 160 jobs caused by the closure of OCLI International at Dalgety Bay in Dunfermline East constituency; urges OCLI to work together with those being made redundant to minimise the difficulties faced by them and their families, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to involve itself fully in the search for a positive resolution to their current plight. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Bristow Muldoon, Donald Gorrie, Irene Oldfather, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Cathy Jamieson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Marilyn Livingstone, Scott Barrie, Alex Neil, Mr Michael McMahon, Andrew Wilson
S1M-1878 OCLI International (lodged on 26 April 2001) Elaine Smith*
